thread.title: Inter-party panels may break logjam in Parliament
thread.title_full: Inter-party panels may break logjam in Parliament

author: New Delhi: Sep 26
title: Inter-party panels may break logjam in Parliament
text:
Inter-party panels may break logjam in Parliament New Delhi: Sep 26, 2015, DHNS: With passing key legislations in Parliament getting more difficult due to opposition protests, the NDA government has proposed inter-party panels to break gridlocks both in Parliament and state legislatures.
A note from the Parliamentary Affairs Ministry said the inter-party panel would be in addition to the existing mechanisms like the Business Advisory Committee (BAC) and all party meetings to resolve Parliamentary and legislature logjams.
Meetings of presiding officers, party whips, Chief Ministers, Parliamentary Affairs Ministers are held regularly to iron out serious differences that paralyse Assemblies and the Parliament.
“In spite of these existing mechanisms, it is a still major challenge of our legislatures to conduct their business smoothly,” the Parliamentary Affairs Ministry note said.
The issue is expected to come up at the All India Whips Conference being organised at Vishakhapatnam next week.
Inter-party panels also give smaller parties a chance to air their views on crucial issues as they often do not get adequate time in Parliament or Assembly sessions.
